H0.text: An atom is rust that results from oxygen and iron combining chemically.

H1.text: Rust is a compound formed by the chemical combination of oxygen and iron.

H2.text: An element is the classification of rust, which forms when oxygen and iron combine chemically.

H3.text: A mixture is the classification of rust, which is formed when oxygen and iron combine chemically.

A4.text: Iron(III) oxide or ferric oxide is the inorganic compound with the formula Fe2O3.

A5.text: Iron(III) oxide is often called rust, since rust shares several properties and has a similar composition; however, in chemistry, rust is considered an ill-defined material, described as hydrous ferric oxide.
